label: Kranky
description:
Over a decade since their last album, Belong return to Kranky with a cloud of compressed, overdriven guitar and tinny drum machine loops contrasted with passages of smudged ambience, somewhere between MBV, JAMC and Vladislav Delay's vaporous dubs.

When Michael Jones and Turk Dietrich released 'October Language' way back in 2006, their careful fusion of shoegaze and digitally-swallowed ambience felt necessary. It was a reaction of sorts not just to Christian Fennesz's digitally... more

release: You Said You'd Hold My Hand Through The Fire
title_full:
Iceboy Violet and Nueen

              —
              You Said You'd Hold My Hand Through The Fire
            
              (Hyperdub)
label: Hyperdub
description:
Pairing up with 3XL/Good Morning Tapes' Nueen, Iceboy Violet sounds energised, tracing the ups and downs of a long romance with pithy rhymes that coil and pirouette through gravelly, back room drill and trap inversions. It's achingly beautiful, soaked with Northern rain and fuzzy, after-hours memories - the mid-point between 6LACK, Unknown T, Slug Christ, Yungwebster and Space Afrika we never knew we needed.

Iceboy Violet's been hinting at something this expansive for a minute now... more

release: Discerned in the fugue of streams ~ Quiet Details
title_full:
R Beny

            —
            Discerned in the fugue of streams ~ Quiet Details

label: Mutualism
description:
Essential listening for fans of aya, Yungwebster and Iceboy Violet, 'D&D' is the longer form debut from cult Manny rapper VHS MIDNIGHT STYLE and British-Cypriot producer Dreeks, a shiny alloy of softly-spoken contradictions and chewy hyperpop/neo club textures. 

"I know I've been awful," VHS MIDNIGHT STYLE mouths ruefully over Dreeks' erratic computerized belches on 'dungeons_&'. Introspective but blessed with witty northern charm, the rapper-producer has built up a dedicated... more

label: Theory Therapy & co:clear
description:
Gorgeously blissed dreamweaving, right at the cusp of ambient and dissolved pop music underlaid with sumptuous subs, featuring guest contributions from k2dj, aka Ben Bondy, and tipped if yr into Malibu/DJ Lostboi, Bianca Scout, Space Afrika, Florian TM Zeisig, Ulla & Ultrafog, Grouper.

Issued via nascent labels co:clear (Glasgow) and Theory Therapy (Sydney), ’Shyness’ is a real gem distilled from aspects of ambient-pop, chamber music, and the liminal points where club echoes fade into the... more

title_full:
Demetrio Cecchitelli

            —
            Jump ~ Le Mont Analogue

label: FELT
description:
Civilistjävel! returns with a beautiful new double album of aqueous home listening skewed by faint vocal whirls and atmospheric dub vapours, featuring collaborations with Laila Sakini, Mayssa Jallad, Thommy Wahlström, ELDON, and Withdrawn.

‘Brödföda’ invites an audience with the esteemed Swede and his peculiar brand of atmospheric isolationism. After gently weaving in the voice of Cucina Povera on the ‘Fyra Platser’ 12”, and reimagining the kosmische dream-pop of Death &... more

release: Slows The Pace And Goes Farther ~ Puddlerunner
title_full:
Mammo

            —
            Slows The Pace And Goes Farther ~ Puddlerunner

label: Smalltown Supersound
description:
Carmen Villain descends deeper into the mutant dub vortex on 'Nutrition', infusing the residue of classic Pole/~Scape, Mark Ernestus and vintage Chain Reaction with a mossy potency that surprisingly and rather brilliantly lines up next to recent work by Carrier and the flickering embers of T++.

After a critically acclaimed last proper album, 'Only Love From Now On', last year's sensual (almost beatless) 'Music from the Living Monument', and a pair of 12” collabs with Huerco S. and Actress... more

release: I was born by the sea
title_full:
Richie Culver

              —
              I was born by the sea
            
              (REIF)
label: REIF
description:
Absolutely class - as in lokey AOTY potential - debut album from Hull-based conceptual artist Richie Culver; cutting to the marrow of modern life in the UK’s hinterlands and peripheries in an essential album for followers of Mark Leckey, Teresa Winter, Blackhaine, Klein, Logos, Dale Cornish.

Building on the cult rep of his initial link-up with Blackhaine in ’21, and subsequent turn on Superpang, Culver gets right under the skin of UK prole life with a poetically astringent insight to northern... more

label: Blundar
description:
Kolorit's Untitled via Blundar.

"The duo of Kolorit are probably best known through their respective solo careers - Jens Kuhn under the guise of Lowtec and Gunnar Wendel as that of Kassem Mosse. That the two would have a duo together should come as no surprise, as Wendel has had numerous releases on Kuhn’s label Workshop through the years. The Kolorit project took shape sometime in 2017 following a night in Bristol where they were both booked for live shows and - on a whim -... more

title_full:
Helena Hauff

              —
              Multiply Your Absurdities
            
              (Tresor Records)
label: Tresor Records
description:
Preeminent DJ Helena Hauff wears her scuzzy production hat for the first time in a few years with a trio of raspy, salty electro-acid and Bunker-styled sluggers on her Tresor debut.

‘Multiply Your Absurdities’ is delivered with the sort of no-nonsense, locked-in drive that makes Hauff so in demand by baying techno crowds across the world. Her title tune registers the EP’s only melodic content in its resonant, briny acid tang and distorted rhythmelodic cadence at a warm-up canter, before she... more

title_full:
Angel R (Florian T M Zeisig)

              —
              Mossed Capable Of Being Observant
            
              (enmossed)
label: enmossed
description:
Infamous cloakroom attendant/Ambient enigma and occasional Kelela producer Florian T M Zeisig unveils his debut album proper as Angel R, draping fragmented rhythmic helixes around hazed, polychromatic soundscapes. It’s properly sensual, vaporous gear, tipped if yr into Jake Muir, Huerco S, Peak Oil, 3XL.

Following on from an excellent split LP with Alliyah Enyo, Florian T M Zeisig’s debut album proper as Angel R fully maps out his sonic topography. Gauzy, weightless soundscapes blur... more

title_full:
Not Waving & Romance

              —
              Wings Of Desire
            
              (Ecstatic)
label: Ecstatic
description:
Ecstatic’s flagship ambient duo take cues from Botticelli’s ‘The Birth of Venus’ for a new journey into the sublime after serving some of this decade’s most cultishly adored sides. This time they give a more surreal and illusive take on their thing, all smudged chorals and strings, rendered like a half remembered fever dream.

The timeless beauty of Not Waving & Romance’s C.15th Italian renaissance muse is echoed in this new eight-part suite that continues in a heart-clutching vein of work... more

label: sferic
description:
Sferic’s urbane ambient apothecary dispense the vinyl debut of instrumental cloudrap convections by cult producer 990x, drifting on smudged air somewhere between Yungwebster, dj lostboi, early Lil B and Space Afrika, via Clams Casino's 'Instrumentals' tapes, Kelman Duran and the Drain Gang axis - primed for gouched-out, floating immersion.

990x has been blurring the line between rap and ambient for almost a decade, breaking up his subby, saturated 808 kicks and itchy percussive trills... more
